task_summary: Place the red can already held by the gripper onto the table surface, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator places a small red soda can onto a white tabletop. The scene shows multiple objects (green bottle, tall red bottle, blue can, gray cup, orange stack). The gripper appears to hold the red can during the approach. The behavior aligns above the placement area, lowers until contact, releases the can, and retreats to a safe height. Timing and forces are kept moderate; precise lateral alignment is used to avoid collisions with nearby objects.
preconditions: Red can is in the gripper
Table surface is reachable and visible
stepwise_plan: Verify the red can is in the gripper.
Approach and align over the intended table placement area with tight tolerance.
Lower until contact is detected at low force.
Place down and release the can.
Retreat to a safe distance from the surface.
success_criteria: Red can rests stably on the table without toppling
End-effector retreats clear of the objects
failure_and_recovery: Contact not detected: re-align and retry lowering.
Can slips during release: regrasp if possible, then repeat placement.
Obstacle interference: adjust lateral pose and reattempt approach.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreating once the can is detected released and stationary on the surface.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector directly above placement area; onset of descent toward surface.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lowering until contact followed by release.

node_specs.description: Check that the gripper currently holds the red can.
Align above the planned placement spot with tight tolerance.
Descend until contact with the table is detected.
Execute the place-down routine while holding the can.
Release the can on the surface.
Back away from the placed object.

failure_modes: No contact detected within allotted descent
Can tips over during or after release
Collision with nearby objects during approach
recovery_strategy: Re-align laterally and retry lowering with same tolerance
If tip detected, regrasp and repeat placement
Adjust approach path to increase clearance
Attempt a second open command; if stuck, retreat and alert
assumptions: Frames show the robot already holding the red can during approach (frames 3â€“5).
Placement target is on the tabletop near the right/center region; exact pose is symbolic as 'place_on_table'.
Instruction matches visuals where the can appears on the table by frame 7.

expected_success_criteria: Object released and static on table
No residual contact forces after release
